title: Accounting Specialist (Inter CA)
description:
Accounting - Team Lead

About Us: Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

 About the Team:  Business finance, also known as corporate finance in the business world, is responsible for allocating resources, creating economic forecasts, reviewing opportunities for equity and debt financing, and other functions within your organization. 

About the Role: We are looking for an Accountant who can manage all finance and accounting Revenue  Recognition, Internal Control, Auditing. Controls, Accounts etc.

Expectations/ Requirements:
1.Should be well versed in handling the day to day accounting related to revenue assurance. Should have good knowledge of various reconciliation methods, GL recons, bank recons, system recons etc.
2. Must posses excellent MS-excel skills and help in automation of revenue and expenses related items.
3. Analyze trends and provide management with a daily summary of the revenue preparation.
4. Adherence to the SOP on multiple matters such as revenue recognition, expenses validation, debtors MIS reporting and collection.
5.Excellent stakeholder management skills for both internal and external stakeholders.
6. Provide support during various audits and month end reporting within given timeliness.

Superpowers/ Skills that will help you succeed in this role:
1. 3-5 years of experience in the transaction-level accounting domain.
2. Excellent knowledge of MS Excel.
3. Should have worked in SAP ERP.
4. Experience in various internal and external audit closure
5. Good Interpersonal communication and presentation skills

Education: Semi - Qualified CA Preferred

Why join us ? A collaborative output driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities solid 360 feedbacks from your peer teams on your support of their goals Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager.

Compensation: If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you With enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 21 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It’s your opportunity to be a part of the story!

title: Ad Sales - Paytm Ads
description:
About Us
Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them into the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

About the role
Paytm Ads is the digital advertising vertical that offers innovative ad solutions to clients across industries. It allows advertisers to engage with over 350 million users who interact with more than 200 payment and retail services—both online and offline—offered by Paytm. Paytm Ads maps user transactions to lifestyle choices and creates customized audience segments, enabling highly targeted and effective ad campaigns.
We are hiring for the role of Advertising Sales Manager for FMCG/CPG verticals.

Job Responsibilities
-Become an expert in Paytm Ads solutions for businesses of all sizes and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs.
-Own end-to-end key business metrics like ads revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with clients, and navigate complex relationships.
-Be the voice of Paytm Ads in the industry and present Paytm's advertising solutions to CXOs, media heads, brand managers, and agency partners of large brands in the market.
-Build a strong pipeline of media briefs and respond with customized pitches and proposals aligned with client business and marketing objectives.
-Work closely with the campaign delivery and optimization team to monitor and deliver expected results to advertisers.
-Lead initiatives requiring significant cross-team collaboration to build innovative advertising solutions for key advertisers.
-Provide constant feedback to the product team to improve advertising performance and customer experience.

Desired Qualifications
-7+ years of experience in advertising sales managing large clients (digital preferred).
-Proven experience in managing programs, categories, or business verticals.
-Strong stakeholder management experience with the ability to work cross-functionally and with teams of diverse skill sets.
-Ability to deep-dive into problems; strong analytical and presentation skills required.
-High bias for action and strong execution focus.
-Ability to thrive and perform in ambiguous settings, with sound judgment and flexibility in managing tight deadlines while ensuring progress across people and projects.

Why Join Us
A collaborative, output-driven program that drives cohesiveness across businesses through technology.
Opportunity to improve average revenue per user by increasing cross-sell opportunities.
Constructive 360° feedback from peer teams for supporting their goals.
A culture of respect that is earned, not demanded—from peers and managers alike.

Compensation
If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you.
With an enviable base of 500+ million registered users, 21+ million merchants, and a deep data ecosystem, Paytm is uniquely positioned to democratize credit for deserving consumers and merchants—and we are fully committed to this vision.
India’s largest digital lending story is unfolding here. It’s your opportunity to be part of it!

title: AM/DM - Employee investigations/Forensics
description:
Job Description: AM/DM - Employee investigations lead
Experience: 3-7 yrs

Qualification: Law/MSW/or Equivalent degree
About Us:Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

Position Summary:The SM/DGM Employee investigations lead is responsible for managing and overseeing all aspects of ethics investigations within the organization. This role requires strong analytical skills, and the ability to maintain confidentiality. The SM/DGM - Employee investigations lead works closely with the Ethics Investigation Leads and various stakeholders to ensure compliance with ethical standards and mitigate potential risks.

Key Responsibilities:1. Conduct Ethics Investigations: Conduct thorough and unbiased investigations into alleged ethical violations, ensuring all relevant information is collected and analyzed. This includes interviewing relevant parties, reviewing documentation, and gathering evidence.2. Evaluate and Analyze Findings: Analyze investigation findings to determine the severity and impact of ethical violations. 3. Maintain Confidentiality: Handle all investigations with the utmost confidentiality and discretion, ensuring that sensitive information is protected. Adhere to privacy policies and legal requirements when handling and sharing investigation findings.4. Develop Investigation Plans: Develop comprehensive investigation plans, including timelines, interview schedules, and evidence collection strategies. 5. Collaborate with Stakeholders: Work closely with HR, legal, and senior management to ensure alignment of investigation processes and outcomes with organizational policies and objectives. Provide guidance and support to stakeholders throughout the investigation process.6. Report and Document Findings: Prepare detailed investigation reports that clearly document the findings, analysis, and recommended actions. 7. Provide Training and Guidance: Develop and deliver ethics training programs to educate employees on organizational policies, ethical guidelines, and reporting procedures. Provide guidance and support to employees and managers on ethical dilemmas and concerns

.Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., law, ethics, CA, MSW etc) required; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience in conducting ethics investigations, preferably in a leadership role.
Strong knowledge of ethical principles, regulations, and industry best practices.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex information.
Demonstrated ability to identify, define and analyze problems, establish decision-making parameters, assess risks and recommend solutions.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to diverse audiences.
High level of integrity and ethical conduct, with the ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information.
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time management skills.
Proficient in using investigation tools and software.

title: Android - Senior Software Engineer
description:
About Us:
Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

About the Role:
Paytm is looking for a Senior Software Engineer with sound knowledge of Android native application development using Kotlin, RXJava, Coroutines, Dagger and its framework. He/She/They will work on an Android application for Android POS devices.

Requirements: 
He/She/They will design and code features for the Android application as per the specifications provided by Product and Design teams.
Write unit tests for all features.
Works closely with Backend, Design and Product Management teams to brainstorm and understand the details of features. 
Should be able to collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and ship new features.
Unit-test code for robustness, including edge cases, usability, and general reliability.
Work on bug fixing and improving application performance.
Continuously discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies to maximize development efficiency.

Skills that will help you succeed in this role: 
Software Engineers with 3 to 6 years of experience in building apps for the Android platform.
Good understanding of Kotlin & Java, Dagger 2, MVVM architecture, Live data, data binding, RxJava2, Room DB, Coroutines.
Good understanding of Android application architecture and design.
Good understanding of memory management, network interaction, debugging, concurrency and multi-threading in Android.
Understanding of complete application development, continuous integration & testing and app distribution infrastructure.
Should be proficient in Kotlin as well as Java.
Should have strong experience of Data Structures, algorithms and Oops concepts.
Prior work experience in Payments Application development will be a plus.

title: Area Sales Manager - Deputy Manager - Transit Offline-Railways
description:
About Us : Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

About the Team : QR/Soundbox team is one of the biggest business and payments vertical in the organisation that is focused on merchant acquisition, merchant retention and growth of merchants in India.

About the Role: Paytm is looking for an experienced sales professional & people manager to be a part of the QR & Sound Box vertical.

Expectations/ Requirements:
 1. Growth of distribution and market share in the assigned area of operations.
2. Visibility & accountability through extensive QR & Sound box, EDC deployment, and sale of the product.
 3. Identify and recruit the sales team to align and drive business in the market.
 4. Plan the market size, span, and geographies for ASMs.
 5. Devise the best methods for communication of plans/targets to the team so as to minimize the expectations vs delivery gap.
 6. Monitor the quality parameters as suggested by the management.
 7. Validate and conduct audits on the acquisitions and sales done by the team.
8. People manage a large team of 5-10 ASMs & 500+ indirect employees.

Must-Have:
1. Should have good networking capabilities and be willing to travel extensively throughout their specified area. 
2. Skilled in coaching and mentoring, a quick learner who grasps and puts into application newly learned ideas and concepts.

Superpowers/ Skills that will help you succeed in this role :
1. Self-starters, who can take ownership and are comfortable navigating ambiguity, will be an ideal fit.
2. Passionate about working in a fast-growing firm.
3. Articulate complex solutions to novice customers.
4. Good sales and negotiation skills. Experience in quota-driven sales is a must.
5. Experience in payments and finance is a plus - though not mandatory.

title: Area Sales Manager - DM / Manager - LRM - Bangalore
description:
About the Role: Paytm is looking for an experienced Sales Leader & People Manager to drive the Merchant Lending business across the assigned region. The role involves scaling merchant loan penetration, strengthening underwriting funnel quality, and unlocking incremental revenue through strategic cross-sell initiatives.

Expectations/ Requirements:
1. Grow Merchant Lending penetration and overall credit distribution in the assigned geography.
2. ⁠Drive visibility & deployment of lending products—Merchant Loans, BNPL, QR-linked credit, overdraft lines, etc.
3. ⁠Lead cross-sell of financial products like Gold SIP, Insurance, and other merchant financial tools to enhance merchant stickiness and revenue-per-merchant.
4. ⁠Identify, recruit, and manage a strong field sales team to accelerate lending acquisition and cross-sell outputs.
5. ⁠Define market size, span, funnel metrics, and territories for Team Leads to maximise efficiency.
6. ⁠Ensure seamless communication of plans/targets, minimising expectation vs delivery gaps.
7. ⁠Monitor and improve portfolio quality metrics—repayment behaviour, fraud checks, documentation hygiene, and onboarding quality.
8. ⁠Conduct audits and validations on loan files, sales processes, and cross-sell adherence.
9. ⁠Lead and mentor a large on-ground structure of 5–10 Team Leads & 100+ indirect employees, ensuring high productivity and compliance.

Must Have
•Strong networking and relationship-building capabilities with merchants and channel partners.
•Willingness to travel extensively within the assigned region.
•Skilled in coaching, mentoring, funnel management, and rapid adoption of new processes and products.

Superpowers / Skills That Will Help You Succeed
1.Self-starter with strong ownership, comfortable navigating ambiguity and a dynamic lending environment.
2.8–12 years of experience in B2C/B2B sales, preferably in financial services, fintech, or high-velocity acquisition-driven setups.
3.Ability to articulate credit products and financial solutions in a simple manner to merchants.
4.Strong negotiation skills, quota-driven mindset, and ability to lead large, aggressive field teams.
5.Experience in payments, lending, or financial products cross-sell is a strong plus.

⸻

Education

MBA (Marketing/Finance preferred)

About the Team: This vertical is a focused offline payment solution team for transit segment, we are predominantly dealing with driver partner onboarding on our Paytm platform and other Retail business with QR Codes, Sound Box and POS machines, handling end to end sales and operations in all offline products. Onboarding new merchants for offline solutions and servicing existing merchants.

About the role: This is a full-time on-site role who will be responsible for managing and acquiring new business accounts, driving sales growth, building and maintaining strong relationships with clients, and providing excellent customer service.

Preferred Domains – Transit Aggregator/Fintech/Bank/Telco/Insurance/ Education: Post Graduate with good academic record.

Experience- Min. 6 years (Good in Excel & data tools required in Sales & managing large set ups both teams & clients)

Responsibilities: -
1. Grow Distribution and Market share in the assigned area of operations.
2. Identify and recruit the sales team to align and drive business in the market.
3. Formulate and launch the counter strategy for local initiatives taken up by the competition.
4. Ability to understand the data to gather the right information and plan the execution accordingly.
5. Analyze the data and identifying the improvement areas, substantiate through market visits to identify the priority spots to perform in.
6. Plan the market size, span and geographies for his team both on & off roles.
7. Should be able to device the best methods for communication of plans/targets to the team to minimize the expectations vs delivery gap.
8. Monitor the Quality parameters as suggested by the management.
9. Validate and conduct the audits on the acquisitions and sales done by the team.
10. Personally manage key accounts when needed.

Why join us
1. A collaborative output-driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology 
2. Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities
3. A solid 360 feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals
4. Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager

title: Associate Vice President - Regulatory Compliance
description:
About Paytm:
Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

About the Team:
The Compliance department has five areas of responsibility—identification,
prevention, monitoring and detection, resolution, and advisory for the entity with respect to regulations/ laws, and is part of the enterprise compliance group at Paytm.

About the role: This role will focus on advising business and overseeing compliance-related matters in the company. The role entails advising in terms of the relevant regulatory expectations to the respective business units and ensuring timely monitoring and detection of compliance-related issues.

Expectations/ Requirements:
1) Oversee and monitor adherence to applicable laws and regulations in the domains of digital lending, offline payments aggregators, BBPS, and UPI TPAP segments.
2) Provide informed compliance opinions to the internal stakeholders on the applicability of regulatory laws and guidelines.
3) Assess compliance and regulatory risks associated with business activities and ensure effective risk management strategies are in place.
4) Collaborate closely and creatively with cross-functional teams to guide the seamless implementation of regulatory guidelines and compliance requirements.
5) Manage audits and ensure timely, accurate responses to regulatory/ third-party inquiries and inspections.
6) Interpret policies, procedures, and compliance requirements while influencing and collaborating with professionals across all organizational levels. Lead and mentor the compliance team to achieve organizational compliance objectives effectively.
7) Ensure effective assessment of control design and maintenance of compliance
framework, training on the regulatory guidelines/ laws and conduct risks, and effective communication of compliance expectations across the organization.
8) Prepare and present clear, concise compliance reports to the management, report to various committees of the board, ensure timely escalations to the Leadership team on incidents of compliance breaches and recommend corrective actions.

Superpowers/ Skills that will help you succeed in this role:
1) 14+ years’ experience in the Compliance team of any NBFC/ Bank/ FinTech

title: Backend - Technical Lead
description:
Backend - Technical Lead

About Us:
Paytm is India’s largest digital payments and financial services platform, leading the mobile QR revolution. We power millions of businesses and individuals, and we’re building scalable, resilient systems to serve half a billion Indians and beyond.
Here at Paytm, technology isn't just about keeping up, it's about building the future. We believe the next generation of engineers must not only scale systems to billions but also leverage AI and GPT tools to accelerate innovation

About the Role:
1) As a Technical Lead, you’ll not just write code — you’ll design scalable architectures, coach engineers, and lead technology-first projects.
2) You'll drive backend systems that support 100M+ DAUs, optimize APIs to sub-50ms latencies, and be a champion of engineering excellence.
3) We expect you to actively use AI tools to accelerate architecture design, code reviews, prototyping, and developer productivity.

What We're Looking For:
1) 6-8 years of hands-on backend engineering experience — Java, Spring Boot, AWS.
2) Proven ownership of high-scale distributed systems. Deep knowledge of microservices, messaging systems, caching, storage optimization, and cloud scalability.
3) Clear architectural thinking; you can design systems for billions of transactions, not just millions.
4) An AI-first mindset — you should know how to augment yourself with GPT and other AI coding tools to move 2x faster.
5) Strong leadership skills — mentoring, code reviewing, pushing for engineering best practices.

Why You Should Join Us:
1) Massive ownership and real-world system building opportunities.
2)  Work with AI, not against it — code smarter, architect smarter, and build smarter.
3)  We are a pure tech-driven team inside Paytm — no unnecessary meetings, no bureaucracy.
4) You’ll work on critical platforms, live user-impacting systems, and future-proof engineering.

Ideal Profile:
1) Obsessed with system scale, performance, and reliability.
2) Already using or excited to use AI tools (GPT, Copilot, etc.) for development.
3) Loves deep backend engineering, and believes technology should move fast, with high impact.
4) Wants to grow into a principal engineer, architect, or CTO over time.

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's/Master's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent

Compensation: 
If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you. With enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 21 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It is your opportunity to be a part of the story!

title: Business Analyst - Manager - Lending Collections
description:
About Us:
Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

Expectations/Requirements

We're looking for an individual with strong business and technical acumen to manage programs, own the data pipeline, generate key insights, and drive efficiency through analytical techniques.

Focus on providing data-driven insights and strategies to increase key business metrics and optimize efficiency.
Function as a results-oriented person with a strong delivery focus who can work both independently and collaboratively.
Prepare reports for management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data.
Use automated tools to extract, clean, and prepare data from primary and secondary sources.
Minimum 2-4 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.
Skills Required

Hands-on with SQL & Python (Advanced SQL is necessary) and comfortable handling very large-scale data.
Hands on working experience on any Dashboarding tool like Looker/Apache Superset
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills; a strong data-driven mindset.
Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial.
Ability to comfortably and confidently present to all levels (technical and non-technical).
Problem-solving ability to assess data required to derive actionable insights.
Excellent expertise in quantitative and qualitative data analysis.
Coding aptitude to easily and effectively build reports from a database.
Proficiency in MS Excel (top-notch skills are necessary).
Any graduate or a Graduate from a Premium Institute is preferred.

Why Join Us:
1.  A collaborative output driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology 
2.  Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities
3.  A solid 360 feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals
4.  Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager

Compensation:
If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you.
With enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 21 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It’s your opportunity to be a part of the story!

5) Develop and implement statistical models to support forecasting, predictive analytics, and optimization
6) Help define and monitor key performance indicators for commerce products
7) Identify opportunities for data-driven innovation and contribute to the development of new product features and capabilities.

1) Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field

4) Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment
5) Experience with data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio or Looker.
6) Proficiency in SQL and experience with database systems such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or HiveQL.
7) Expertise with programming languages such as Python or R is a plus

title: Business Analyst - Process Re-Engineering
description:
Job Description: Process Engineering - Business Analyst 

About Us
Paytm is India’s leading digital payments and financial services company. It focuses on driving consumers and merchants to its platform by offering diverse payment use cases. Paytm empowers consumers with services like utility payments and money transfers using instruments such as Paytm Wallet, UPI, FASTag, and Postpaid (Buy Now, Pay Later). For merchants, Paytm provides acquiring devices (Soundbox, EDC, QR, Payment Gateway) for payment aggregation.

About the Role
The Process Engineering - Business Analyst will focus on optimizing the entire data lifecycle— from extraction and processing to reporting, dashboard creation, and final analytical output. The primary goal is to streamline analytical processes to provide swift, highly visible, and accurate data-driven insights, ensuring the operations are scaled and efficient.

Key Expectations/Requirements (Process Engineering Focus)

Data Process Design & Automation: Design and build processes for automated data extraction, report/dashboard automation, and aligning stakeholders onto a common platform to increase data visibility. Execute these processes with the operations team and define SLA & KPI for the same.
Deep Business Analysis & Opportunity Spotting: Conduct detailed business analysis, outlining problems and opportunities for the business by scrutinizing operational and analytical workflows.
Business growth & Enhance profitability: Strong understanding of the business & ability to identify areas of focus/ opportunities to maximize business growth & enhance profitability
Performance Metrics Engineering: Develop robust metrics and action points that can be used to drive in-house and external operations performance improvement and scalability decisions. Partner with operations teams (in-house and external) to identify and track appropriate performance measures, Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and associated drivers.
Strategic Data Deployment: Work with data-engineering and data science teams on designing, building, and deploying data analytics systems for large data sets and extracting meaningful data for the operations team.
Executive Reporting & Automation: Create reports, dashboards, and automation to provide insights to all stakeholders. Design dashboards for merchant communications and automate them to supplement the effort of internal stakeholders.
Driving Targets: Drive team performance as per business objectives and strive for higher targets on a time-to-time basis. 

Superpowers/Skills Required

Business Acumen & Outlook: Strong business outlook with the ability to translate operational and market challenges into analytical requirements and process solutions.
Ownership & Drive: High sense of ownership in spotting and owning the end conclusion of identified initiatives—driving analytical projects and process changes from conception through successful deployment.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven ability in making cross-functional collaboration work, specifically across Operations, Data Engineering, and Product teams, to implement process changes smoothly.
Detail-Oriented & Accuracy: Detail oriented with the ability to maintain the highest standards of accuracy in data reporting and process documentation.
Analytical & Technical Proficiency:Strong background in statistical concepts and calculations with 7+ years experience working with real data.Innovative, strong analytical and algorithmic problem solver.
Proficiency with statistical analysis tools (e.g., R, Python), data visualization (Tableau, Power BI, etc.), data extraction tools (Oracle, Hive, MySQL), and presentation (MS Excel, Powerpoint, etc.).Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.

Education B.Tech or Equivalent .

Why Join Us
Be part of a collaborative, output-driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology.Help improve the average revenue per use by increasing cross-sell opportunities.Benefit from solid 360-degree feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals.Experience respect that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager.

Compensation:
If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you. You will be part of India’s largest digital lending story, leveraging 500 million+ registered users and 21 million+ merchants.

title: Business Analyst - Team Lead - Business Lending
description:
Role: Business Analyst - Team Lead - Lending (Personal Loan)

About Us:

Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology

About the team:
Being one of the largest payment platforms in the country, we aim to not only ensure a seamless experience, but also a delightful journey for our customers. We strive to enrich the customer experience by making every transaction transparent, honest, and hassle-free.

About the Role:
Business analyst focuses on data, statistical analysis and reporting to help investigate and analyze business performance, provide insights, and drive recommendations to improve performance.

Expectations/ Requirements:
1. Derive business insights from data with a focus on driving business-level metrics.
2. Ability to interact and convince business stakeholders.
3. Developing insightful analysis about business and their strategic and operational implications.
4. Partner with stakeholders at all levels to establish current and ongoing data support and reporting
needs.
5. Analyze data from multiple angles, looking for trends that highlight areas of concerns or opportunities.
6. Design, create and deliver data reports, dashboards, extract and/or deliver presentations to strategic
questions.
7. Identifying data needs and driving data quality improvement projects.

Key Skills Required:
1. Ideally,have 2-3 years of experience working on data analytics and business intelligence. Candidates from b2c consumer internet product companies are preferred.
2. Proven work experience on MS Excel, Google analytics, SQL, Data Studio, any BI Tool, business analyst or similar role.
3. Should be comfortable working in a fast-changing and ambiguous environment.
4. Critical thinking and very detail-oriented.
5. In-depth understanding of datasets, data and business understanding.
6. Capable of demonstrating good business judgement.
7. Must know Python and have a working knowledge of Pyspark and Jupyter notebook

Education: Applicants must have an engineering academic background with specialisation in data science

Why join us: We aim at bringing half a billion Indians into the mainstream economy, and everyone working here is striving to achieve that goal. Our success is rooted in our people’s collective energy and unwavering focus on the customers, and that’s how it will always be. We are the largest merchant acquirer in India.

Compensation: If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you
With enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 21 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It is your opportunity to be a part of the story!

Business Development - Senior Manager - Travel (Flights)
description:
About Us
Paytm is India’s leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. A pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technology that empowers small businesses with payments and commerce. Our mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them into the mainstream economy through technology.

About the Travel Team
Paytm Travel has revolutionized the Indian travel industry with a mission to empower millions of travelers who choose us as their preferred travel partner. Within just a few years, we’ve become the #3 player in India’s online travel space, and we’re on track to becoming #1 soon.
Asone of the largest travel platforms in the country, we aim to make every travel experience seamless, transparent, and delightful — from instant booking to hassle-free journeys. With customer centricity at our core, our vision is to make Paytm Travel synonymous with trust and affordability for all travelers.

About the Role
We’re looking for a smart, driven, and domain-strong business professional with 7+ years of experience in Business Development, Partnerships, and Account Management in the travel industry — preferably with direct experience in airline operations, ticketing systems, and OTA distribution models.This is a strategic role where you’ll help scale the Flights vertical by driving new partnerships, optimizing supplier integrations, and enabling operational excellence in airline distribution and automation.

Key Responsibilities
1. Business Development & Strategic AccountabilityStrategic Roadmap: Execute the Flights vertical roadmap in line with company objectives, ensuring operational and technical feasibility.
Revenue Enablement: Identify and activate new airline and supplier partnerships to drive volume and improve margins.
Resource Optimization: Design initiatives to address operational challenges such as budget constraints or GDS integration bottlenecks.
Process Innovation: Enhance workflows for partner onboarding, contracting, and automation of ticketing and after-sales processes.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Finance, Product, Growth, and Operations teams to ensure alignment on business goals.
2. Technical Excellence & Product IntegrationSystem Expertise: Deep understanding of airline ticketing systems, GDS/CRS platforms (Amadeus, Sabre, Travelport), and emerging distribution models like NDC.
Issue Management: Lead root-cause analysis and resolution of operational and tech issues (PNR cancellations, ADM/ACM disputes, API failures).
Tech Partnership: Collaborate with Engineering, QA, and Product teams to ensure travel systems are scalable, reliable, and optimized for uptime.
Feature Deployment: Oversee pre- and post-deployment validation for new capabilities such as ancillaries, branded fares, and direct airline integrations.
3. Partner & Account ManagementAirline Relationship Management: Build and manage strong commercial relationships with airlines, consolidators, and GDS providers.
Competitive Intelligence: Analyze industry trends, competitor fare strategies, and distribution models to identify growth opportunities.
Co-Creation: Collaborate with partners to co-design win-win product and pricing models, including dynamic fares and exclusive deals.
4. Operational LeadershipTicketing Process Excellence: Define best practices for ticket issuance, reissue, refund, and exchange workflows.
Market Insights: Conduct route-level and inventory analysis to guide airline strategy and promotional opportunities.
Cross-Team Coordination: Partner with CX, Tech, and Growth teams to deliver consistent traveler and partner experiences.
Automation & Compliance: Drive automation in fare caching, reconciliation, and reporting to ensure compliance with airline and IATA standards.

Ideal Candidate ProfileExperience:
7+ years in business development/partnerships within travel or airline domains.
5+ years in OTA or airline environments, with hands-on experience in airline reservation and ticketing systems.

Skills & Competencies:
Airline Domain Expertise: Strong command over airline ticket issuance, GDS/CRS workflows, BSP/ARC settlements, and ADM/ACM management.
Technical Acumen: Familiarity with travel tech stacks (API integrations, NDC, fare caching, automation workflows).
Negotiation Skills: Proven success in closing high-value airline or supplier deals.
Execution Focus: Bias for action with experience scaling new airline integrations or distribution models.
Stakeholder Influence: Ability to manage and align cross-functional teams toward business outcomes.

Key Success Metrics
Growth in direct airline partnerships and supplier-driven revenue
Improved efficiency in ticket issuance and reconciliation
SLA adherence for customer issue resolution
Enhanced operational reliability and automation adoption

Why join us:
Because you get an opportunity to make a difference, and have a great time doing that. You are challenged and encouraged here to do stuff that is meaningful for you and for those we serve. We are successful, and our successes are rooted in our people's collective energy and unwavering focus on the customer, and that's how it will always be

Compensation:

title: Business Finance - Process Re-Engineering
description:
Job Description: Process Engineering - Business Finance

About Us

Paytm is India’s leading digital payments and financial services company, focused on driving consumers and merchants to its platform by offering a variety of payment use cases. Paytm provides services like utility payments and money transfers to consumers, enabling payments via instruments like Paytm UPI, FASTag, and Postpaid (Buy Now, Pay Later). For merchants, Paytm offers acquiring devices (Soundbox, EDC, QR, Payment Gateway) and commerce services through advertising and the Paytm Mini app store. Leveraging this platform, the company also offers credit services such as merchant loans, personal loans, and BNPL, sourced by financial partners.

About the Role

The Process Engineering - Business Finance role will be critical in optimizing and standardizing financial operations across the organization. This role involves overseeing financial control and risk management from a process perspective , specifically focusing on streamlining planning, reporting, and controlling activities. The person will be responsible for bringing financial discipline by designing, documenting, and implementing efficient financial processes and controls, acting as a key business partner for project and process improvement initiatives.

About the Team

The Business Finance team manages the raising and managing of funds by business organizations. The financial manager, who is usually close to the top of the organizational structure, is responsible for planning, analysis, and control operations. This role will work closely with financial managers and cross-functional teams to embed efficiency into these core operations.

Key Expectations/Requirements (Process Focus)

Process Improvement & Documentation: Design, standardize, and document key Business Finance processes (e.g., budgeting, financial forecasting, reporting, capital expenditure management) to enhance efficiency, control, and scalability.
Performance Monitoring: Implement automated monitoring of key performance indicators (KPIs), focusing on process metrics, and highlight trends or variances caused by process bottlenecks or inefficiencies
Financial Modeling Support: Develop and improve financial models and analyses by ensuring the underlying data flows and calculation processes are robust, accurate, and repeatable.
Reporting Streamlining: Oversee and manage the continued development of tools for budgeting, forecasting, and operating plans, with a specific focus on optimizing the generation of Quarterly and Monthly Financial reports.
Data Integrity & Control: Ensure the highest standards of accuracy and precision in financial data processes , providing timely and accurate financial recommendations to management based on well-governed data.
Ad-Hoc Process Analysis: Conduct ad-hoc analysis and reporting  to identify and resolve root causes of process breakdowns or data quality issues.
Strategic Support: Support Senior Management Team and Department Heads by providing in-depth process analysis and insights that drive operational and financial decisions.Drive Cost Optimization initiatives to directly improve overall
Profitability
Must have a 10x mindset approach  towards problem solving.

Superpowers/Skills Required

Education: Qualified CA/ MBA.
Experience:8+ years.
Technical Proficiency: Expertise in MS Excel, Tableau, and Power BI for deep analytical reporting.
Ownership & Drive: Demonstrated ownership in spotting issues, proposing solutions, and driving the end conclusion of identified initiatives to successful implementation. Highly-driven and self-motivated.
Collaboration: Proven ability to make cross-functional collaboration work effectively, balancing finance needs with business operational requirements.
Communication & Assertiveness: Highly articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Being assertive to enforce process standards, control requirements, and timely delivery across different departments.
Execution: Demonstrated ability to roll-up sleeves and work with team members in a hands-on management capacity.
Mindset: Ability to think creatively about process redesign , highly organized.

Why Join Us

Be part of a collaborative, output-driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology.Improve business performance by increasing cross-sell opportunities and enhancing the average revenue per use.Receive solid 360-degree feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals.

Compensation:
If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you.You will be part of India’s largest digital lending story, leveraging 500 million+ registered users and 21 million+ merchants to democratize credit.

title: Business Partnerships Health Insurance Manager
description:
About Us – Paytm is India's payment Super App offering consumers and merchants most comprehensive payment services. Pioneer of mobile QR payments revolution in India, today, Paytm is India’s largest payment company by Users, Merchants, Payment Transactions and Revenue. Paytm’s mission is to drive financial inclusion in India and bring half a billion Indians into the mainstream economy through technology-led financial Services. Paytm enables commerce for small merchants and distributes various financial services offerings to its consumers and merchants in partnership with financial institutions. 
Paytm has been a pioneer in the merchant space by introducing innovative solutions like QR codes to accept payments and Sound-box to recon payments by voice alerts. We are also distributing loans to these partners via our ‘Paytm for Business’ App.

Key Responsibilities:
Manage strategic partnerships with insurers to maximize business volumes, profitability, and customer satisfaction.
Lead negotiations on commission structures, pricing, product offerings, and exclusive partnership deals.
Analyze insurer performance metrics, identify growth opportunities, and implement improvement plans.
Facilitate product development and integration discussions between Paytm and insurers, ensuring alignment with market demands.
Collaborate closely with internal teams (product, technology, sales, and marketing) to ensure successful execution of insurer strategies.
Regularly review partnership agreements and compliance requirements, ensuring adherence to IRDAI regulations and internal governance.
Generate and present reports on partnership outcomes, challenges, and recommendations to senior management.

Qualifications and Experience:
Bachelor/MBA or equivalent qualification from a reputable institution.
2-3 years of experience in insurance partnership management, business development, or product management roles into Health Insurance Domain.
Strong negotiation, analytical, and stakeholder management skills.
In-depth knowledge of the Indian insurance market and IRDAI regulatory environment.

title: Business Transformation &  Project Management (Non Tech)
description:
Job Description: Project Management & Business Transformation

Department: Process Engineering

Industry: Fintech

About the Role

The Project Management & Business Transformation role, within the Process Engineering department, is a critical position focused on driving large-scale, cross-functional strategic initiatives to optimize core business processes, enhance efficiency, and ensure robust control across the organization. This role requires a blend of expert project management, deep business acumen, and a process-oriented mindset to successfully execute transformational changes within a fast-paced fintech environment. 

Key Responsibilities & DeliverablesStrategic Project & Program Management

Ability to identify areas of focus/ opportunities to maximize business growth & enhance profitability
Customer backward approach / tech automation mindset approach
Resource Alignment: Manage and align resources across multiple, concurrent projects, including securing commitment from business, technology, finance, and operations stakeholders.
Risk & Change Management: Proactively identify project risks, dependencies, and bottlenecks. Implement effective change management strategies to ensure smooth adoption of new processes and systems by end-users.

Business Process Transformation & Improvement
Current State Analysis: Conduct detailed assessments of current state business processes to identify pain points, bottlenecks, control gaps, and opportunities for efficiency gains (utilizing Lean, Six Sigma, or other relevant methodologies).
Future State Design: Collaborate with business owners to design the optimized, future state processes, ensuring compliance, enhanced customer/merchant experience, and operational efficiency.
Process Implementation: Drive the implementation of designed processes, working closely with the Technology teams for automation and the Training teams for organizational readiness.

Cross-Functional Leadership & Communication
Stakeholder Management: Act as the primary liaison between executive leadership, Process Owners, Technology, and Finance teams. Translate business transformation goals into detailed project plans and operational requirements.
Executive Reporting: Prepare and present concise, data-driven reports and roadmaps to senior management, clearly communicating project status, critical decisions needed, and the projected impact of transformation efforts.
Driving Consensus: Be a persuasive and assertive leader who can navigate organizational politics, drive consensus, and ensure all functions are aligned and committed to the final transformed process.

Superpowers/Skills & Qualifications

Technical & Professional Requirements
Experience: 10+ years of overall professional experience, with a minimum of 5 years focused on leading large-scale, complex business or process transformation projects, preferably in the Fintech, Telecom, or Banking sectors.
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Finance, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Certifications (Preferred): PMP/Prince2, Certified Scrum Master (CSM), and/or Process Improvement (Lean/Six Sigma Black Belt).Fintech Domain Knowledge: 
Strong understanding of core fintech/payments processes, including Transaction Lifecycle, Reconciliation, Revenue Assurance, Compliance (KYC/AML), and Financial Reporting.
Tool Proficiency: Expertise in Project Management tools (e.g., Jira, MS Project, Asana) and Process Mapping tools (e.g., Visio, Lucidchart).Core Competencies (Soft Skills)
Strategic Ownership: Demonstrated ability to take full ownership of complex, multi-year initiatives, anticipating challenges and driving the process to the end conclusion, not just managing tasks.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven track record of making cross-functional collaboration work effectively by bridging the gap between technical, operational, and financial teams.
Assertiveness & Influence: Highly assertive communication skills with the ability to influence senior stakeholders and hold teams accountable for commitments and timelines.
Change Agent: Ability to operate as a change agent, inspiring confidence and driving cultural shifts towards process discipline and operational excellence.
Analytical Thinking: Exceptional ability to decompose complex problems, identify root causes, and structure solutions.

title: Campaign Manager
description:
About Paytm
Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology. 

About the Role:
We are looking for an experienced Campaign Manager who can assist in the Planning, Execution, and Optimization of our digital campaigns.

Responsibilities:
● The role will include conceptualizing, drafting, and executing campaigns on various platforms.
● Formulate segments & target pipelines suited to each of the categories and campaigns.
● Running campaigns on Paytm properties and other digital paid media.
● Measurement of campaign performance and maintaining performance data.
● Coordinating with various stakeholders for creatives, campaign segments, data analytics, etc.

Requirements:
● End to End Campaign Management.
● Should have 1-3 years of experience in campaign management in the Insurance domain or Fintech digital space.
● Good understanding of Marketing Automation tools like Clevertap, Moengage, etc.
● Bachelor's degree from an accredited university or college.
● Proficient in MS Office.
● In-depth understanding of customer behavior, browsing and transacting trends, visual merchandising, and execution.
● Ability to identify workflows and formulate processes.
● Ability to define metrics for measurement.

Why join us?
A collaborative output driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities A solid 360 feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager

Compensation:
If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you with enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 25 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It’s your opportunity to be a part of the story.

title: Commodity Operations-Paytm Money
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented and process-driven Back Office Executive to handle post-trade operations and settlement activities for commodity trading. The ideal candidate will manage daily reconciliation, reporting, client documentation, margin monitoring, and compliance with exchange and regulatory norms.
 
1.      In depth knowledge of commodity trading, settlement process, margin systems, and delivery processes.
2.      Familiarity with exchange guidelines and settlement cycles.
3.      Commodity Trade processing & reconciliation
4.      Manage pay-in/pay-out process for funds and commodities as per exchange timelines.
5.      Verification of Statutory levies, charges, income etc.
6.      Coordination with clearing members for commodity settlement and pay-in/pay-out activities.
7.      Manage uploads and downloads of trade files, margin reports etc.
8.      Regulatory compliance & reporting 
9.   Experience in Audit/Inspection handling
 
 
Qualification :
·         Bachelor's degree
·         3–5 years of experience in commodity back office operations (MCX/NCDEX).
 
Preferred skills :
·         Proficiency in MS Excel and back-office trading tools.
·         Strong communication and time management skills.
·         NISM – Commodity Module certification

title: Content and Communication Manager – Paytm Money
description:
Content and Communication Manager – Paytm Money
Designation: Manager
Location: Bengaluru / Noida
Compensation: Competitive, aligned with experience

Role Overview
We are looking for a Content and Communication Manager who can make investing simple, relatable, and inspiring for millions of Indian consumers.
This role blends storytelling, consumer engagement, and performance-driven content strategy to help users discover, understand, and act on their financial goals with Paytm Money.
You will lead the entire content and communication ecosystem across brand campaigns, app journeys, SEO-led discovery, and lifecycle marketing. As a player coach, you will be hands-on with writing, ideation, and strategy while mentoring a high-performing team.

title: Contract Negotiations - Assistant Manager
description:
Role Summary
As Assistant Manager – Contract Negotiations, you will manage a diverse portfolio of legal responsibilities including drafting and negotiating contracts, ensuring regulatory and compliance adherence, and handling dispute resolution. You will collaborate closely with multiple internal stakeholders — product, engineering, finance — to support business growth while safeguarding Paytm’s legal and compliance interests. You will also work on creating and implementing standardized contract templates to improve efficiency and consistency across agreements.

Key Responsibilities
Draft, review, negotiate, and finalize a variety of contract types — including vendor agreements, partnership contracts, service agreements, licensing agreements, NDAs, and other business contracts.
Develop and maintain standardized contract templates and frameworks to streamline contracting processes, reduce turnaround time, and ensure consistency across business units.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, engineering, operations, finance) to incorporate legal and compliance requirements — including intellectual property protections, data security, regulatory constraints — into product development and business contracts.
Conduct regulatory compliance assessments and ensure that all contracts comply with applicable laws, internal company policies, and relevant regulations — especially given the regulatory environment in fintech/financial services.
Manage the full contract lifecycle: from initiation, drafting, negotiation, execution, monitoring, amendments/renewals, to expiry / termination as needed.
Maintain accurate contract records, manage documentation / contract repository, and track key milestones (renewals, obligations, deliverables, compliance checkpoints).
Identify and assess potential legal and business risks associated with contractual agreements — propose mitigation strategies or alternative contract terms to protect company interests.
Handle contract-related disputes or issues with counterparties, working to resolve disagreements or breaches amicably, in line with company policy.
Act as a legal-business interface: communicate contract terms, implications, obligations to internal stakeholders (business teams, finance, operations) to ensure mutual understanding and smooth execution.
Provide legal guidance and support for new business models, vendor partnerships, collaborations — ensuring all contractual agreements align with business objectives and compliance standards.

Qualifications & Skills
Bachelor’s degree in Law (LLB) / Business Law / or equivalent legal / corporate governance qualification. (Advanced degree or MBA + Legal exposure is a plus.)
Minimum 3–5 years of experience in contract drafting, negotiation, and legal/compliance work — preferably in fintech, financial services, technology, or other regulated industries.
Strong understanding of contract law, regulatory compliance, data privacy / security norms (especially relevant to fintech), IP protection, and risk mitigation.
Excellent contract drafting, negotiation, analytical, and risk-assessment skills.
Strong communication and stakeholder-management capabilities — able to liaise with business, product, finance, engineering and legal teams to translate legal requirements into business-ready contracts.
High attention to detail, discipline, integrity, and ability to handle confidential, sensitive information.
Ability to manage multiple contracts simultaneously, prioritize workloads, meet deadlines — with strong documentation and record-keeping discipline.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment (like fintech) and adapting to evolving regulatory/business requirements.
Familiarity with contract management tools / contract lifecycle management (CLM) software and standard office productivity tools (MS Office / Google Workspace).

title: Creative Designer - Team Lead - Paytm Ads
description:
About Us:
Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology

About the team:
Paytm Ads is Paytm's digital advertising vertical that offers innovative ad solutions to clients across industries It offers advertisers the opportunity to engage with 300Mn+ users who interact with over 200 payment & retail services, online and offline - offered on the Paytm app. Paytm Ads maps the user transactions to their lifestyle choices and creates customized segmentation cohorts for sharp shooting ad campaigns to the most relevant TG.

About the Role:
We’re seeking a Creative Design Lead to own and drive the visual communication strategy for in-app ad campaigns, marketing collaterals, and innovation projects across the Paytm Ads ecosystem.
As the Creative Design Lead, you'll manage end-to-end design responsibilities from stakeholder communication and creative strategy to hands-on design execution and team management. You'll collaborate cross-functionally with business, marketing, and product teams to deliver high-impact, performance-oriented creatives.

Key Responsibilities:
Creative Direction & Execution
Lead the design development for in-app ad creatives, banners, videos, and marketing campaigns.Translate briefs into strong visual concepts aligned with brand and campaign goals.
Team & Stakeholder Management
Manage and mentor a team of junior designers, providing feedback and quality control.Liaise with internal stakeholders, category teams, account managers, and product owners to align on campaign objectives and timelines.
Cross-Platform Visual Communication
Design marketing collaterals including case studies, sales decks, social media creatives, and video assets.Work on campaigns tailored for both merchants and consumers across categories.
Creative Testing & Performance Optimisation
Lead bi-weekly A/B testing of creatives and derive learnings from ad performance metrics like CTR and ecpm.
Process & System Design
Contribute to developing creative guidelines and templates for Paytm’s self-serve ad platform.Streamline design processes and maintain consistency in visual language.

Qualifications:
-8–10 years of experience in creative or visual design, with at least 1–2 years in a lead or managerial role.
-Strong portfolio showcasing marketing collaterals, digital banners, video snippets, and ad creatives.
-Proficiency in tools like: Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, After Effects, Premiere Pro) & Figma
-Basic knowledge of motion/animation is a plus.
-Experience working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
-Proven ability to deliver high-quality work under tight deadlines.
-Excellent communication and project management skills.-Experience working with external clients or brand teams.
-Preferred: Background in ad-tech, digital marketing, or performance marketing.

What You’ll Gain
-Ownership of the design for a fast-growing ad platform reaching millions.
-Opportunity to work on diverse campaigns..
-Leadership role with visibility across business, marketing, and product functions.
-Fast-paced, collaborative, and entrepreneurial work environment.

Why join us?
·         A collaborative output driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology
·         Improve the average revenue per use by increasing the cross-sell opportunities
·         A solid 360 feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals
·         Respect, that is earned, not demanded from your peers and manager
 
Compensation: If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you With enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 21 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it. India’s largest digital lending story is brewing here. It’s your opportunity to be a part of the story!

About Us: Paytm is India's leading financial services company that offers full-stack payments & financial
solutions to consumers, offline merchants and online platforms. The company is on a mission to bring half a
billion Indians into the mainstream economy through payments, commerce, banking, investments, and financial
services. One97 Communications Limited that owns the brand Paytm is founded by Vijay Shekhar Sharma.

About the role: Candidate has to handle concerns and complaints raised by the customer day to day basis and
make sure the daily task is being closed within the defined TAT with good customer experience.

Expectations/ Requirements
We are looking for a Customer Support Agent to handle inbound & outbound calls and email queries from customers. The role involves providing accurate resolutions, maintaining customer satisfaction, and updating all interactions in DevRev CRM.

Key Responsibilities:
Handle customer queries via calls and emails within defined SLAs.
Ensure timely, accurate, and compliant resolutions.
Maintain quality, CSAT, and productivity as per process KPIs.
Update customer interactions in DevRev CRM.
Follow process guidelines and adhere to Zero Tolerance (ZT) policies.
Requirements:
Graduate in any discipline (mandatory).
0–3 years of experience in a voice & email support process.
Insurance domain experience preferred.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
Work from Office with roster-based week off.

Compensation: If you are the right fit, we believe in creating wealth for you
With enviable 500 mn+ registered users, 21 mn+ merchants and depth of data in our ecosystem, we are in a
unique position to democratize credit for deserving consumers & merchants – and we are committed to it.

title: CST Operations - Executive/Sr. Executive - Paytm Travel CST (Flights)
description:
About Us:  Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology.

 Job Summary: We are seeking highly motivated and experienced resources within our Flights Line of Business. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the flight/travel industry, especially on GDS (Amadeus & Travelport), excellent analytical skills.. This role is critical in ensuring a seamless and positive experience for our customers booking flights through our platform. 

Responsibilities: 

Customer Experience: 
● Ensure the team provides exceptional customer service across all channels (phone, email, chat, social media). 
● Handle escalated customer issues and complex inquiries. 
● Identify and address trends in customer complaints and feedback. 
● Proactively identify opportunities to improve the customer experience. 

Operational Excellence: 
● Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify areas for improvement in operational efficiency. 
● Implement process improvements and best practices to enhance team productivity and customer satisfaction. 
● Collaborate with other departments (e.g., product, engineering, growth, and finance) to resolve customer issues and improve the platform. 
● Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in customer service. 

Reporting and Analysis: 
● Prepare regular reports on team performance and customer experience metrics.
● Analyse data to identify trends and insights that can be used to improve customer service and operational efficiency. 
● Use data to make informed decisions about resource allocation and process improvements. 

Qualifications: 
● Bachelor’s degree in a related field preferred. 
● Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in customer service, preferably in the flight/travel industry.
● Sound knowledge of flight/travel terminology, processes, and GDS systems (e.g.,Amadeus,Sabre, Galileo). 
● Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
● Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
● Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.  
● Proficiency in using CRM software and other customer service tools.  
● Strong customer focus and a passion for delivering exceptional customer service. 

Preferred Qualifications: 
● Experience with Amadeus/Travelport is a must. 
● Knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint) and Google tools. 
● Familiarity with customer satisfaction metrics and measurement methodologies like Service Level Adherence, Re-open rate, FCR, FRT, CSAT and Escalation rate.

Why Join Us:
1.  A collaborative output-driven program that brings cohesiveness across businesses through technology 
2.  Improve the average revenue per user by increasing the cross-sell opportunities
3.  A solid 360 feedback from your peer teams on your support of their goals

title: Customer Acquisition
description:
About Us:

Paytm is India's leading mobile payments and financial services distribution company. Pioneer of the mobile QR payments revolution in India, Paytm builds technologies that help small businesses with payments and commerce. Paytm’s mission is to serve half a billion Indians and bring them to the mainstream economy with the help of technology. About role: We are seeking a highly motivated and fast-executing Customer Acquisition Executive to drive on-ground outreach and acquisition initiatives. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, possesses strong communication skills, and demonstrates high ownership over key operational metrics.

Key Responsibilities
● On-Ground Execution: Demonstrate a willingness to work on-ground and execute high-speed acquisition activities in target locations.
● Stakeholder Coordination: Efficiently coordinate with colleges, corporates, markets, and other external locations to secure necessary permissions and approvals for acquisition drives and events.
● Communication & Reporting: Maintain good spoken English and language skills for professional interactions. Utilize good WhatsApp and email communication skills for quick updates and documentation.
● Operational Excellence: Exhibit high speed and strong ownership of acquisition targets, ensuring timely and effective campaign rollout and performance.
● Team Collaboration: Work directly with a centralized team, maintaining constant availability and providing support, including during weekends, as required by operational demands.
● Problem Solving: Quickly identify and resolve logistical or communication barriers encountered during on-ground activation. Required Skills & Attributes
● Proven ability to be a fast executor with a strong focus on immediate results.
● Excellent spoken English and language skills are mandatory.
● Proficiency in professional WhatsApp and email communication.
● Demonstrated strong ownership and accountability for assigned tasks.
● Ability to be always available and willing to support during the weekends.
● Experience in coordinating logistics and obtaining external permissions is highly desirable.

title: Customer Support - Associate - CST
description:
About Us:
 Paytm is India’s leading digital payments and financial services company, which is focused on driving consumers and merchants to its platform by offering them a variety of payment use cases. Paytm provides consumers with services like utility payments and money transfers, while empowering them to pay via Paytm Payment Instruments (PPI) like Paytm Wallet, Paytm UPI, Paytm Payments Bank Netbanking, Paytm FASTag and Paytm Postpaid - Buy Now, Pay Later. To merchants, Paytm offers acquiring devices like Soundbox, EDC, QR and Payment Gateway where payment aggregation is done through PPI and also other banks’ financial instruments. To further enhance merchants’ business, Paytm offers merchants commerce services through advertising and Paytm Mini app store. Operating on this platform leverage, the company then offers credit services such as merchant loans, personal loans and BNPL, sourced by its financial partners.

About the Role
Respond to customer inquiries, concerns, and complaints
Provide accurate and timely information about products, services, policies, and procedures.
Ability to work with internal teams to resolve customer queries
Compose thoughtful and accurate messages or customize prepared
Responses to suit the requirement for a specific case resolve customer issues and complaints effectively, striving for first contact resolution (FCR).
Document customer interactions and maintain accurate records in the system.
Collaborate with other departments, such as product, business spoc to address customer needs.

title: Data Protection Manager-Paytm Money Limited
description:
Role Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Data Protection and Privacy Manager, who will be responsible
for overseeing the organization's data protection strategy and ensuring compliance with Indian
laws such as the Information Technology Act, 2000, and the Personal Data Protection Bill.The
DPPM will work closely with DPO and regulatory authorities to ensure that sensitive data is
processed securely and ethically. This role is crucial in safeguarding our digital assets and
maintaining compliance with industry standards and law.

Key Responsibilities:
● Legal Compliance: Ensure adherence to data protection laws, including local DPDPA,
IT Act and international regulations like GDPR.
● Policy Development: Formulate and implement data protection policies and guidelines
across the organization.
● Data Breach Management: Investigate and report data breaches to relevant authorities
within the stipulated timeframe.
● Training & Awareness: Conduct training sessions for employees on data protection
practices and raise awareness about privacy policies.
● Impact Assessments: Perform Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIA) to identify
risks and recommend mitigation strategies.
● Grievance Redressal: Act as the point of contact for data principals (individuals) for
grievances related to data handling or privacy violations.
● Recordkeeping: Maintain records of all data processing activities and policies for audit
and regulatory purposes.
● Liaison:With regulatory agencies and stakeholders regarding data protection matters.

Qualifications and Experience:
1. Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Computer Science, and Law.
2. Certification in Data Protection or Privacy Management is mandatory, like - CIPM,
CDPSE, DCPLA, DCPP and DCDPO
3. 8-10 years of experience in security management.
4. Strong understanding of IT infrastructure , data security best practices, and frameworks.
5. Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards (e.g., RBI, SEBI).
6. Excellent communication, interpersonal, analytical and leadership skills.
7. Knowledge of emerging technologies, their impact on data protection and ability to
handle sensitive information discreetly.

title: Deputy Manager- Employee Ethics & Investigation
description:
Job Title: Manager – Employee Escalations, Ethics & Compliance

Function: Ethics & Compliance
Location: India
Reporting To: Ethics Investigation Lead / Head – Ethics & Compliance

About the Team
The Ethics & Compliance team is responsible for building, implementing, and sustaining a strong ethics and integrity framework across the organization. The team works closely with cross-functional partners and internal/external stakeholders to manage employee escalations, conduct investigations, identify control gaps, develop dashboards and trackers, and promote a culture of ethical conduct and accountability across the enterprise.

About the Role
The Manager – Employee Escalations, Ethics & Compliance will be responsible for managing and overseeing employee-related escalations, ethics investigations, and fraud risk matters across the organization. The role requires strong investigative judgment, analytical capability, and the ability to handle sensitive matters with discretion.The incumbent will work closely with the Ethics Investigation Lead, HR, Legal, Risk, and senior leadership to ensure timely, fair, and compliant resolution of employee escalations while mitigating ethical, reputational, and regulatory risks.

Key Responsibilities

Employee Escalation & Ethics Investigations
Conduct independent, thorough, and unbiased investigations into employee escalations, alleged misconduct, ethical breaches, and fraud-related concerns.
Collect, review, and analyze evidence including documentation, system data, and interview inputs.
Ensure investigations are completed within defined timelines and in line with internal policies.
Analysis & Risk Assessment
Evaluate investigation findings to assess severity, root cause, and potential business impact.
Identify patterns and recurring issues to proactively mitigate future risks.
Conduct periodic ethics and compliance risk assessments across business functions.

Confidentiality & Governance

Maintain strict confidentiality and discretion throughout the investigation lifecycle.
Ensure adherence to data privacy requirements, labor laws, and regulatory obligations applicable in India.
Handle sensitive information in line with organizational and legal standards.

Investigation Planning & Execution
